messages.subject: [SPAM] Re: [nihontostudy] Re: It is very quiet here
messages.msgSnippet: This group is GREAT! I took your thoughts and will re-opened the books to study the AKAO group or Ha. And I will bring Umetada and Akasaka influence s into
messages.messageBody:
This 'group' is GREAT!

I took your thoughts and will re-opened the books to study the 'AKAO'
group or Ha. And I will bring Umetada and Akasaka influence's into
the picture (maybe Shoami).

As far as Echizen (not Kinai), Akao tsubako were there.

Thanks for the leads,

Elliott

messages.subject: Re: [SPAM] Re: [nihontostudy] Re: It is very quiet here
messages.msgSnippet: As a combination, some of the earlier Akao artists worked in Echizen, I am at work and need a book here seriously (I have nothing else to do) but from memory,
messages.messageBody:
As a combination, some of the earlier Akao artists worked in Echizen, I
am at work and need a book here seriously (I have nothing else to do)
but from memory, the early Akao stuff was from Echizen, then they moved
to Kyoto after the second or third master..

I hope that is correct. I am running on gray matter here.

This is I believe Echizen Akao.
http://www.nihontokanjipages.com/personal/collection/akao.htm

Rich

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: It is very quiet here
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Elliott - I can see why you though Akasaka-something but if not that, look at Akao group perhaps. I m not coming up with any positive thoughts here, just
messages.messageBody:
Hi Elliott -

I can see why you though Akasaka-something but if not that, look at Akao group perhaps. I'm not coming up with any positive thoughts here, just throwing out some idea. Doesn't look Kyo-sukashi to me. As for Echizen...Echizen what? Echizen makes me think Kinai and that's not Kinai work from what I can tell. Nice tsuba. The fukurin could be added later so I guess one should think of it "without" that addition.

Ron
STL

----- Original Message -----
From: Elliott
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, July 16, 2007 6:28 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: It is very quiet here


I am still here!

After thumbing thru many books and web sites, I have decided to name
my mysterious Tsuba (the one mounted on my Hiramasa) Echizen Sukashi.
If you go to my album (Elliott's Album) and look at photo's 1 thru 7,
tell me if you agree or what you think.

I first thought Kyo-sukashi but Gordon said "I don't think so." Then
I was leaning towards Akasaka but the Fukurin was telling me "no". So
I threw my hands up and pondered other stuff.

It wasn't until I was 'talking' to Andy Quirt when I ask him and he
suggested Echizen. I hadn't thought of that but I went to searching
and maybe............it is!

What do you think?

Elliott
--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Richard Turner" <ikkanshi@...>
wrote:
>
> Is anyone around ?.
>
> RichardTurner
>

messages.subject: Re: [SPAM] Re: [nihontostudy] It is very quiet here
messages.msgSnippet: Certainly will spend some time at Dai Token Ichi but also as a few shops of preference and of course time at the NBTHK. Last year we saw the usual display and
messages.messageBody:
Certainly will spend some time at Dai Token Ichi but also as a few shops of preference and of course time at the NBTHK. Last year we saw the usual display and a little later, the display of newly designated Juyo items. With two blades being submitted this year, wouldn't it be nice to see one of my own there! Optimist yes, but "never count thy chickens..."

Ron
STL

----- Original Message -----
From: ikkanshi@...
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, July 16, 2007 4:52 PM
Subject: Re: [SPAM] Re: [nihontostudy] It is very quiet here


Excellent work on the beer, I like the cut of your jib.

I too will be heading to Tokyo for the DTI (fingers crossed), it will be
great to catch up again. Oh, I assume that's whatyou are going for Ron ?.

Richard

Ron Hartmann wrote:
>
> Hi Richard -
>
> "Nobody here but us chickens" as the old saying goes...yes, it's been
> downright dead on all the lists. Guess it's the summer doldrums (or
> winter doldrums) or something. Been spending more hours on my antique
> beer steins (and some time with the more usable ones, too) instead of
> swords and fittings. Things might get more active soon. I've got my
> ticket for the SF show in four weeks and also plan on going back to
> Japan in late October, my second adventure there. Then we have our KTK
> weekend coming up in September.
>
> Ron
> STL

messages.messageBody:
I am still here!

After thumbing thru many books and web sites, I have decided to name
my mysterious Tsuba (the one mounted on my Hiramasa) Echizen Sukashi.
If you go to my album (Elliott's Album) and look at photo's 1 thru 7,
tell me if you agree or what you think.

I first thought Kyo-sukashi but Gordon said "I don't think so." Then
I was leaning towards Akasaka but the Fukurin was telling me "no". So
I threw my hands up and pondered other stuff.

It wasn't until I was 'talking' to Andy Quirt when I ask him and he
suggested Echizen. I hadn't thought of that but I went to searching
and maybe............it is!

What do you think?

Elliott

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] It is very quiet here
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Richard - Nobody here but us chickens as the old saying goes...yes, it s been downright dead on all the lists. Guess it s the summer doldrums (or winter
messages.messageBody:
Hi Richard -

"Nobody here but us chickens" as the old saying goes...yes, it's been downright dead on all the lists. Guess it's the summer doldrums (or winter doldrums) or something. Been spending more hours on my antique beer steins (and some time with the more usable ones, too) instead of swords and fittings. Things might get more active soon. I've got my ticket for the SF show in four weeks and also plan on going back to Japan in late October, my second adventure there. Then we have our KTK weekend coming up in September.

Ron
STL

----- Original Message -----
From: Richard Turner
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, July 16, 2007 4:34 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] It is very quiet here


Is anyone around ?.

RichardTurner
